column4: [ubuntu newbie] I'm having problems with apt-get - I can't install basically anything. Where can i find documentation about the apt-get tool (I don't have man and can't install it)
what's the issue?
I'm getting "dpkg: error processing tzdata (--configure)" on everything
what happens if you try re-installing tzdata?
Actually the problem started with man-db (--configure), and reinstalling it made it uninstalled....
but i'll try, just a sec
Apparently you  can't remove tzdata. It's uninstalls almost every package on ubuntu
right, there's a ton of packages that are dependent on it. Hang on...
Isn't is cool that you need to type in "Yes, do as I say!"?
huh?
When you apt-get remove tzdata you need to confirm by typing in "Yes, do as I say!"
sudo dpkg-reconfigure tzdata
trying, thanks
tzdata is broken or not fully installed
k that's what I thought. One second.
do you have an nvidia card?
ok, so there's no harm in trying this then. apt-get purge nvidia-common, then apt-get install nvidia-comon
ok, trying
the purge returned an error: Setting up tzdata (2010m-0ubuntu0.10.04) ...
tell me about it :)
